issue.title: Remove package name validation from classpath scanning

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

body:
Good catch, @paplorinc

How did you find it? Entered an invalid package name and JUnit Platform Commons didn't fail?

I wonder, if we, instead of fixing and maintaining this code, should add a `requires java.compiler;` directive to the `org.junit.platform.commons` module descriptor and use the [SourceVersion::isKeyword](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/16/docs/api/java.compiler/javax/lang/model/SourceVersion.html#isKeyword(java.lang.CharSequence)) method directly.

We've been generating packages randomly and using JUnit to validate them.

I've added https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/pull/2571, lemme' know if you think we should require compiler instead.

> We've been generating packages randomly and using JUnit to validate them.

Using hidden (as in not exported) `PackageUtils` directly?

https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/main/junit-platform-commons/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/commons/util/package-info.java#L2-L8

A bug is a bug, though - as I said: good catch!

> I've added #2571, lemme' know if you think we should require compiler instead.

Slated for 5.8 M2 for team discussion - we'll get back to you soon.

> Any usage by external parties is not supported

I wasn't complaining :)

> I wonder, if we, instead of fixing and maintaining this code, should add a `requires java.compiler;` directive to the `org.junit.platform.commons` module descriptor and use the [SourceVersion::isKeyword](https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/16/docs/api/java.compiler/javax/lang/model/SourceVersion.html#isKeyword(java.lang.CharSequence)) method directly.

Actually, we did this to get rid of that dependency in https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/1995. However, we could add a test-only dependency write a test that checks both behave the same.

Yes - yet in 2021, we might want to reconsider this decision.

Or, as this is the only place that method is used in out production code...

https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/9558af1961a8f539288f4c7ac59d4666417c9990/junit-platform-commons/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/commons/util/ClasspathScanner.java#L73

...we could also drop the check entirely.
Lemme' know, and I'll update my PR
**Team decision:** Remove `PackageUtils.assertPackageNameIsValid` class and usage in `ClasspathScanner` and adjust tests accordingly.

rename.from: Validate packages against every Java keyword
rename.to: Remove PackageUtils and package name validation

rename.from: Remove PackageUtils and package name validation
